meanings.definition: A sensory nerve ending that is excited by changes in pressure.
meanings.sent1: The baroceptor in my hand helps me feel when I squeeze something tightly.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study the baroceptor to understand how our bodies respond to pressure.
meanings.sent3: The baroceptor went on strike, refusing to sense any more pressure changes.
meanings.sent4: Her intuition acted like a baroceptor, warning her of the impending emotional pressure.
meanings.sent5: The baroceptor, like a tiny pressure detective, sends signals to the brain about changes in force.
